users.about_me:
**English** 

Hi, I’m Laetitia – the hands and heart behind Madame Filou.
I live in a small town in Germany, surrounded by forests and soft hills, where I spend my days knitting, designing, and dreaming of quiet moments.

My knitting journey began with a deep love for natural fibers, texture, and timeless silhouettes. I work mostly with rustic wools, tweeds, and mohair blends – yarns that tell a story, just like the garments we create from them.

Each piece I design is a reflection of my slow, mindful approach to life – soft, wearable, and rooted in warmth.
I especially love working with balloon sleeves, delicate lace details, and earthy tones that remind me of autumn walks and linen dresses fluttering in the wind. My patterns are available in english and german

On Instagram (@mme_filou), I share glimpses into my creative process, swatches in the sunlight, and the occasional knitting poem.
If you love wool, cozy textures, and slow moments – you’ll feel right at home.

**Deutsch**

Hallo, ich bin Laetitia, Gründerin und Designerin von Madame Filou.
Ich lebe in einer kleinen Stadt in Deutschland, umgeben von Wäldern und sanften Hügeln. Hier entstehen meine Strickdesigns in einem ruhigen, langsamen Arbeitsrhythmus.

Meine Verbindung zum Stricken begann mit einer Faszination für natürliche Fasern, strukturierte Oberflächen und zeitlose Silhouetten. Ich arbeite überwiegend mit rustikalen Wollgarnen, Tweeds und Mohairmischungen.  Materialien mit Tiefe, Charakter und Geschichte.

Jedes Design folgt einem bewussten, reduzierten Ansatz. Die Stücke sollen weich, tragbar und langlebig sein. Besonders prägen Ballonärmel, feine Lochmusterdetails und erdige Farbtöne meine Arbeit. Inspiriert von Herbstlandschaften, gedämpftem Licht und der Schlichtheit von Leinenstoffen.

Meine Strickanleitungen sind auf Deutsch und Englisch erhältlich.

Auf Instagram (@mme_filou) teile ich Einblicke in meinen kreativen Prozess, Maschenproben im Tageslicht und ruhige Arbeitsmomente.
Wenn du natürliche Materialien, ehrliche Texturen und einen entschleunigten Zugang zu Kleidung schätzt, wirst du dich hier wiederfinden.

name: Sea Fret Sweater
notes_html:
MATERIALS
● Hobbii Tweed Delight, 85% wool/10% acrylic/5% viscose, 50g/100m/109yds
Yarn A: Pink Confetti 16 x 7 (9, 11) balls
Yarn B: Misty Blue 07 x 1 (2, 2) ball(s)

● Stitch marker

YARN ALTERNATIVES
You can use any aran-weight smooth yarn to achieve a similar effect.

TENSION
Work 12 extended treble sts and 6 rows of main stitch pattern in two-row repeat to measure 10 x 10cm/4 x 4in using 8mm hook, or hook size required to obtain tension.

pattern_author.name: Eleonora Tully
pattern_author.notes:
My name is Eleonora. I am half Dutch, half English and live on the south east coast of England with my husband, three fast growing children and a Miniature Schnauzer called Salty.

I am passionate about crochet! I am a crochet designer and draw so much inspiration from the sea and coastal surroundings where we live… 

I have crocheted for many years having initially learnt in my childhood and more recently undertaking the  International Diploma in Crochet. As a result my crochet designs are very varied and I have enjoyed using a variety of crochet techniques including Tunisian crochet, Broomstick crochet and Filet crochet.

I love sharing my passion for crochet and my love of the craft with others and enjoy teaching in crochet classes, writing my 'Coastal Crochet' blog and sharing photos on Instagram as @coastalcrochet

I have had many designs published in crochet magazines including ‘Simply Crochet’, ‘Inside Crochet’ and ‘Crochet Now’.

users.about_me:
I live by the sea on the South East Coast of England. I was born in The Netherlands as my mother is Dutch and my father is English. 
Crochet has always been a part of me, it really has! My mother crocheted her own wedding dress in 1974 and I was wrapped in crocheted blankets soon after I was born! I really did grow up in a ‘handmade home’ with little crocheted curtains above the windows made by my mother and grandmother (very popular in The Netherlands in the 1970’s), there were crocheted pot holders in the kitchen, my cardigans and jumpers were knitted, school dresses sewn and toys crocheted! 
So it was a natural progression for me to be a crafty person into adulthood. Crocheting professionally started when I began writing my crochet blog ‘Coastal Crochet’ in 2015 www.coastalcrochet.com and I also enrolled on the International Diploma in Crochet course. As a result my crochet skills are varied and diverse.
I have had many designs published in all the main UK crochet magazines and I enjoy collaborating with others too.

gauge_pattern: stockinette stitch in the round after blocking.
name: Ringrostig Sweater
gauge_description: 26 stitches and 34 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch in the round after blocking.
notes_html:
This pattern will be released January 29th

When I saw the yarn I immediately knew that I wanted to start the yoke pattern in grey and then continue to make the red the main colour with the yellow as a pop.

Sizes: 1 (2, 3, 4, 5) (6, 7, 8, 9)
Finished Bust Circumference: 84 (89, 96, 106, 120) (129, 142, 151, 157) cm / 33 (35, 37.8, 41.7, 47.2) (50.8, 55.9, 59.4, 61,8)“
Recomended ease 0-5 cm / 0-2”
Suggested yarn: 2 ply Gotlandsgarn from Avelsås Ull & Inredning. 100 g = 400 m.
Main colour: Lite ringrostig No 1330
Contrast colour 1: Grå No 2
Contrast colour 2: Plötsligt händer det No 1305
Yarn: MC: 257 (270, 290, 310, 340) (360, 385, 400, 420)g
CC1: 50 (50, 56, 60, 65) (70, 75, 75, 80) g
CC2: 18 (18, 20, 20, 25) (25, 26, 27, 30) g
Suggested needles: 3 mm circular needles (US2.5) 40, 60, 75 cm for stockinette.
3,5 mm circular needles (US4) for colour work
2,75 mm circular needles (US2) for rib
Gauge: 26 sts x 34 rnds = 10x10 cm / 4x4”. Measured over stockinette stitches in the round after blockning using 3 mm (US2.5) needle.
Notions: Stitch marker, stitch holder or wast yarn, scissors, tapestry needle for weaving in ends.

~ This sweater is worked from the top down, which means that you can try it on as you go.

~ The stranded colour work is read from charts.

~ You can modify your sweater to have any length of the body and sleeves to fit you. Do take into account that modifications will affect the yardage required.

~ To choose the right size for your body, measure around your full bust, then add the recomended ease 0-5 cm / 0-2” and pick the size closest to that number. The bust circumference in the sizes is the finished sweater measurements.

Techniques used:
Cast on
Knit
Purl
Short rows / Wrap & Turn
Stranded colour work read from charts
Increases
Decreases
Cast on with Backward loop method
Pick up stitches
Bind off

name: Renée sweater
gauge_description: 25 stitches and 43 rows = 4 inches
notes_html:
Important!
Before you start knitting, make sure to knit a gauge swatch. Everyone knits with a different tension — I tend to knit quite tightly, which is why my gauge is 25 stitches x 43 rows per 10 × 10 cm.

The yarn manufacturer lists a gauge of 22 stitches x 30 rows, but treat this only as a reference. The most important thing is to match the gauge to your own knitting style — this will ensure that your sweater fits well and looks the way it should.

Renée Sweater is a simple, timeless raglan sweater designed for everyday wear. Clean lines, a classic V-neck and an uncomplicated construction make it a calm, intuitive knit — perfect if you enjoy focusing on the rhythm of the stitches.

The sweater is worked top-down in the round, allowing you to easily adjust the length of the body and sleeves as you go.
There is no short-row shaping, and the silhouette stays straightforward and relaxed.

Construction details:

  • top-down raglan construction
  • worked in the round
  • classic V-shaped neckline
  • straight sleeves, knitted in the round
  • no sleeve tapering
  • simple, minimal finish

Sizes
S (M) L (XL) XXL (XXXL)

Yarn
Isager Eco Baby
10 (11) 12 (14) 14 (15) skeins

Needles
3.5 mm circular needles, 60 cm cable
3.0 mm circular needles, 40 cm cable

Additional tools

  • two cable needles or stitch holders
  • 3.0 mm crochet hook
  • tapestry needle
  • scissors

users.about_me:
Hi, I’m Paulina and I knit.

My love for sweaters is what brought me to knitting in the first place.
It started with my mom, who had a closet full of cozy cardigans that I used to “borrow,” dreaming of having a collection of my own.

When I started buying sweaters myself, I quickly realized nothing felt quite right.
Most were black, grey, or white — and if there was color, it wasn’t my color.

Knitting became my way to create the wardrobe I wanted.
Now it’s also a form of therapy, a moment of calm, and a daily dose of color.
I love bold shades, relaxed silhouettes, and projects with personality.

I sometimes abandon a project halfway when inspiration strikes elsewhere.
And yes, I’ve left sweaters unfinished for more than one winter. But I always know which yarn would be perfect for them.

Writing, designing, and sharing are all part of how I see knitting:
Not just a craft — but a mindset. A way of seeing yourself, the world, and what truly matters.

name: Thea Sweater
gauge_description: 16 stitches and 8 rows = 4 inches in pattern repeat
notes_html:
The Thea Sweater is crocheted from the bottom up. Start by working the back, then proceed with the front. The sleeves are worked from the top down in rows, starting at the armhole and continuing to the cuff. Ribbing edge is worked at the neckline.

Level: beginner friendly.

This pattern includes written instructions as well as numerous video tutorials to guide you through all steps. You will also find instructions on how to change the length as you like.

Sizes
XS, (S), M, (L), XL, (2XL) to fit a bust circumference of: 80 – 85; (85 – 90); 90 – 95; (95 – 100); 100 – 110; (110 – 120) cm; 31 ½ - 33 ½; (33½ - 35½); 35½ - 37½; (37½ - 39½); 39½ - 43¼; (43¼ - 47¼) inches.

Finished measurements (wet blocked)
Circumference: 98, (103), 108, (116), 126, (131) cm.
Length (in the mid back neck excluded): 45, (45), 48, (48), 51, (51) cm.

Designed with 16 - 18 cm of positive ease.

Please note that measurements may vary based on changes you can make in the pattern.

Gauge
10 x 10 cm = 16 sts x 8 rows with 4.5 mm hook wet blocked in stitch pattern.

Materials
Hook: 4.5 mm, or sizes needed to obtain gauge.

Notions: Scissors, removable stitch markers, a measuring tape and a tapestry needle.

Yarn
6, 7, 8, 9, 10, 10 balls of any DK-weight cotton/cotton blend yarn or any other yarn that allows you to obtain the correct gauge.

For my pink sweater in size M, 8 balls of Mon Amour microfiber yarn by Miss Tricot Filati are used (50 g/ 135 m).

Other yarn options: Peo 30 by Silke or Cotton Merino by Drops Design can work as well.
Please note that the amount of yarn is an estimate and will vary if you choose a different length than the one indicated.

WRITTEN IN US CROCHET TERMINOLOGY

Happy Crafting!

ITALIANO

Il maglione Thea viene lavorato dal basso verso l’alto. Si inizia con il dietro, proseguendo poi con il davanti. Le maniche vengono lavorate dall’alto verso il basso in righe partendo dal giromanica e proseguendo fino al polsino. I polsini ed il bordo del collo sono rifiniti all’uncinetto con un punto a coste 1/1.

In questo pattern troverai istruzioni dettagliate e numerosi video tutorial che ti guideranno in tutti i passaggi più importanti, dall’inizio alla fine del lavoro. Troverai inoltre istruzioni come modificare la lunghezza a tuo piacimento.

Livello di difficoltà: Principiante

Taglie
XS, (S), M, (L), XL, (2XL)
Le misure XS, (S), M, (L), XL, (2XL) vestono una circonferenza busto di: 80 – 85; (85 – 90); 90 – 95; (95 – 100); 100 – 110; (110 – 120) cm.

Il maglione Thea è progettato per avere un agio positivo di circa 16 – 18 cm, il che significa che misurerà circa 16 – 18 cm in più della tua circonferenza busto.

Misure del capo finito (dopo il lavaggio e il bloccaggio)
Circonferenza: 98, (103), 108, (116), 126, (131) cm.
Lunghezza: 45, (45), 48, (48), 51, (51) cm.

Viene indicata la lunghezza del maglione rosa, il maglione bianco è lavorato con un misto lana in una versione leggermente più corta.

Si prega di notare che le misure possono variare in base alle modifiche apportate nel pattern.

Campione
10 x 10 cm = 16 m x 8 righe con uncinetto 4.5 mm in pattern.

Materiali
Uncinetto: 4.5 mm, oppure il numero che ti permette di ottenere il campione indicato.
Avrai bisogno di alcuni marcapunti, forbici, metro e un ago da maglia.

Filato
6, (7), 8, (9), 10, (10) gomitoli di cotone, misto-cotone, lana, oppure qualsiasi altro filato dello spessore DK.
Per il mio maglione rosa in taglia M ho usato 8 gomitoli di microfibra Mon Amour di Miss Tricot Filati (50 g/135 m).

Si prega di notare che la quantità del filato potrebbe variare in base alla lunghezza del tuo maglione.

Buon Lavoro!

name: Mini Dachshund in Sweater
notes_html:
PATTERN ONLY!

Make your own adorable and soft Amigurumi crochet Mini Dachshund With Sweater stuffed animal! Purchase to download the PDF pattern with photo assembly instructions to crochet your Mini Dachshund With Sweater!

This listing is an original pattern written by myself (Rachel Wisneski, HookingCuteCreations) in English using US Crochet Terminology to crochet your own amigurumi Mini Dachshund With Sweater. Crochet the lovable Mini Dachshund With Sweater.

Mini Dachshund With Sweater measures approximately 4” tall x 7” long

IMPORTANT, PLEASE NOTE: PURCHASE OF THIS ITEM IS FOR A DIGITAL PDF CROCHET PATTERN (INSTANT DOWNLOAD), NOT THE FINISHED TOY. NO REFUNDS GIVEN FOR DIGITAL PURCHASES.

This 4 page Mini Dachshund With Sweater amigurumi pattern includes detailed instructions.

This pattern is suitable for those with intermediate crochet skills and have knowledge of magic ring/circle, crocheting in spirals/rounds, chain, slip stitch, single crochet, changing colors, increase and invisible decrease.

You will need:

• 3.5mm crochet hook

Red Heart® Super Saver (7oz, 198 g; 364yds, 333m)
Contrast A: Caffe Latte 1 skein
Contrast B: Gold, Spring Green, Light Pink, Light Blue, or any color of your choice 1 skein
Contrast C: White 1 skein
Contrast D: Black 1 skein (enough to embroider
a nose)

name: Savanna Sweater
gauge_description: 14 stitches and 7.5 rows = 4 inches
notes_html:
THIS PATTERN IS CURRENTLY IN TESTING AND WILL BE RELEASED FEBRUARY 27TH, 2026

The Savanna Sweater is a timeless transitional piece designed
with everyday wear in mind. The relaxed fit is slightly oversized for
comfort without being cumbersome. A contrasting stitch pattern
at the top of the shoulders and back, give a dynamic mix of
texture. The slightly opaque fabric of the bodice is breathable
and inviting, combined with the pop of shell stitches give
sophistication to the design. Relaxed fit sleeves embellished with
the same shell design sets this sweater apart from the rest in all
the right ways. This quick project can be made in just a few days
as the perfect weekend crochet pattern.

Materials:

  • Any 4.5mm crochet hook
  • Any #4 worsted Weight Yarn
  • 4 Stitch Markers
  • Measuring tape
  • Darning Needle
  • Scissors
  • Blocking Materials: optional but recommended

Pattern Notes:

  • Written in US Crochet terms
  • Pattern Difficulty: Beginner / Advanced Beginner
  • Mark Right Side where (RS) is indicated
  • Stitches between asterisks * are to be repeated across/around
  • Sizes are written in color coded order: Xs, Small, Medium, Large, Xl, 2X, 3X, 4X, 5X

Construction:
The Savanna Sweater is made in one piece. We will start
with a small section of the Back first and fasten off. For the
Front rejoin the yarn to the foundation chain and work the
Shoulders separately. Once the appropriate number of
rows are made, join the two Shoulders/Front sections with
the Back to create the Body. Continuing to work in turning
rounds until the Bodice is completed. Slightly tapered
Sleeves are then worked directly onto the sweater from
the Armholes, creating an easy no seam sweater.

THIS PATTERN IS A PART OF A COLLECTION. FIND ALL OF THE SAVANNA PATTERNS HERE:

Savanna Cardigan: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/savanna-cardigan-2

Savanna Tank Top: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/savanna-tank-top

Savanna Top: https://www.ravelry.com/patterns/library/savanna-top

pattern_author.name: Amber Zumbrun
pattern_author.notes:
Welcome to my pattern store. 
Hey yall! I'm Amber. I'm a stay at home mom of 3, a wife, gaming nerd, book lover, tattoo enthusiast, coffee drinker, crochet and knit loving gal. 
My favorite part of crocheting and knitting is definitely designing and bringing those ideas to life. 

I love it even more when other's get to re-create my work. It makes me so happy seeing all the beautiful things my fellow makers create and it gives me the drive to continue designing unique, one of a kind patterns.

Although I have been designing for a couple of years I am still learning new techniques to improve my pattern writing, layouts and product photography. I write my patterns with beginners in mind so it’s important to me that my patterns are not only size inclusive, but also ability inclusive. I have received wonderful feedback from crocheters and knitters alike about how easy it is to understand my patterns. That makes me really happy! If you have a question about one of my patterns, please do not hesitate to reach out for help.


I love Instagram and seeing your progress and your projects, so feel free to connect with me (heartfullystitched) so I can see your makes! I can’t explain how gratifying it is to see yall enjoying an item made from one of my patterns. It’s my absolute favorite part of my work. I hope you find as much joy and happiness from them as I do!

users.about_me: Hi, I'm Amber and welcome to my shop! I am a full time stay at home mom and wife. After finding out that we were expecting a little girl during my first pregnancy, I was gifted a beautiful, handmade crochet blanket from my mother-in-law. I fell in love with it and couldn't stop admiring the stitch work. So my mom bought me my first set of hooks, a few skeins of yarn and I haven't been able to put them down since, which is now going on 5 years. After following nothing but patterns for the first couple of years, I really wanted to venture off and design my own items, especially clothing. I love the beautiful, modern take on such an old craft and it feeds my creativity each time I come up with something new. I hope my designs inspire and bring joy to others.

name: Painted Fern Sweater
sizes_available: Size 1 = 37”/93 cm, Size 2 = 41”/103 cm, Size 3 = 45”/113 cm, Size 4 = 49”/123 cm, Size 5= 54”/135 cm, Size 6 = 58”/145 cm, Size 7 = 60”/150 cm, Size 8 = 65”/163 cm, Size 9 = 69”/173 cm.   Sizes based on the garments finished bust circumference of garment
gauge_description: 16 stitches and 21 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette & Colorwork
notes_html:
Painted Fern Sweater

A cozy, oversized knit featuring bold yoke texture and thoughtful modern shaping.

Painted Fern Sweater is a top-down, seamless design that explores multiple raglan-style increase lines paired with a striking central colorwork motif. The yoke grows organically as you knit, creating visual interest while maintaining a relaxed, wearable silhouette.

Designed to fit like a favorite oversized sweatshirt, Painted Fern balances structure and softness. Clean body and sleeve lines allow the yoke to shine, while cozy finishing details — including a folded collar and Italian bind-offs — bring polish and comfort to the finished garment.

This is a sweater for knitters who enjoy watching fabric unfold stitch by stitch, and for wearers who love an easy, relaxed fit with a little something special.

✨ Design Features

• Top-down, seamless construction
• Multiple raglan-style increase lines for a unique yoke structure
• Bold colorwork motif worked through the yoke
• Ladderback Jacquard technique used to manage long floats
• Oversized, sweatshirt-style fit
• Optional short-row shaping at the back hem for added length
• Folded collar with elastic bind-off for structure and comfort
• Italian sewn bind-offs at hem and cuffs
• Designed for yarns with a light, fluffy halo
• Bulky-weight gauge for a warm, cozy fabric

❤️ Skill Level – Intermediate

This pattern is best suited to knitters comfortable with top-down sweater construction, working in the round, and following shaping instructions. Experience with colorwork is helpful, and the Ladderback Jacquard technique is introduced and explained for managing long floats.

An engaging and rewarding knit that remains approachable with careful attention to stitch placement and pattern rhythm.

Sizes

Designed to be worn with generous positive ease.

Finished bust circumference:
37 (41, 45, 49, 54, 58, 60, 65, 69)”
93 (103, 113, 123, 135, 145, 150, 163, 173) cm

Recommended positive ease: approximately 8–12” / 20–30 cm
Sample shown with 11” / 28 cm of ease on a 38” / 95 cm bust.

Suggested Yarn

Sample Version – Oversized fit with folded collar

Main Color (MC)
Rowan Mode – Softest Alpaca, color Linen. 70% Alpaca, 23% Nylon, 7% Wool. 142 yd / 130 m per 50 g ball. Required:
615 (680, 750, 815, 900, 965, 1000, 1082, 1150) yd
560 (620, 690, 745, 825, 880, 915, 990, 1050) m

Contrast Color (CC)
Isager Yarn – Eco Soft, color EO (Natural). 56% Baby Alpaca, 44% Pima Cotton. 137 yd / 125 m per 50 g ball. Required:
105 (115, 125, 137, 150, 162, 170, 180, 195) yd
96 (105, 114, 125, 138, 150, 155, 165, 180) m

For best results, choose yarns (or a yarn combination) with a light, fluffy look and a soft halo to enhance the motif and overall coziness of the garment.

Needles & Notions
Needles
• US 10 / 6.0 mm – body and sleeves (needles for gauge)
• US 9 / 5.5 mm – hem (needles one size smaller than those for gauge)
• US 8 / 5.0 mm – collar and cuffs (needles two sizes smaller than those for gauge)

Notions
• 11 (11, 11, 11, 15, 15, 19, 19, 19) stitch markers for raglan placement
• One distinct BOR marker
• Tapestry needle
• Waste yarn or stitch holders for sleeves

name: Skye Sweater
gauge_description: 13 stitches and 11 rows = 4 inches in yo slst BLO
notes_html:
The Skye Sweater was inspired by the yarn itself. After working with Glory, its softness and drape inspired me to create an oversized crochet sweater with a knit-like look, a modern silhouette, and a relaxed fit, perfect to wear with a good pair of jeans.
The raglan sleeves make it even more comfortable, while ribbed details add structure and a clean finish to the oversized shape. A skinny scarf, inspired by Y2K fashion, brings a feminine touch and complements the wide boat neckline.
With its low-gauge construction, the Skye Sweater is a quick and satisfying project.

The pattern includes written instructions, schematics, and video tutorials to guide you along the way.

Size XS ~900m
Bust: 33.1in / 84cm

Size S ~990m
Bust: 35.4in / 90cm

Size M ~1070m
Bust: 37in / 94cm

Size L ~1200m
Bust: 39.8in / 101cm

Size XL ~1315m
Bust: 42.5in / 108cm

Size 2X ~1460m
Bust: 45.3in / 115cm

Size 3X ~1660m
Bust: 48in / 122cm

Size 4X ~1760m
Bust: 51.2in / 130cm

Check on my instagram @hilo_studio

name: Childhood Hills Sweater KAL
gauge_description: 24 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches
notes_html:
Join us for the Childhood Hills Sweater Knit-Along, a cozy top-down sweater inspired by the bold, uncomplicated shapes found in childhood landscape drawings.

KAL Schedule:
Part 1 – Available for download now
Part 2 – February 8
Part 3 – February 15

Special Offer:
$2.00 (until January 31st 2026)
$7.99 from 1st February 2026

How to Join:
Buy the pattern on Ravelry.

Favorite the pattern and add your project on Ravelry — feel free to share your swatch or progress along the way. I’d love to see it!

Share your knitting on the Facebook group, Knitting is my Yoga or on Instagram using the hashtag #ChildhoodHillsSweaterKAL.

Knit at your own pace — this KAL is all about enjoying the process and the journey.

Notions:
You’ll need a US Size 2.5 (3 mm) circular needle and a US Size 4 (3.5 mm) circular needle, both 40” (100 cm) long for knitting in the round.

Sizes:
1 / 2 / 3 / 4 / 5 / 6 / 7 / 8 / 9

Gauge:
24 sts & 30 rows = 4” / 10 cm in stockinette stitch using a 3.5 mm needle.

name: Sweater No. 9 light
gauge_description: 20 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Sweater No. 9 is a classic raglan sweater with a high, ribbed neck.
A timeless and elegant knitted piece with a beautiful drape and comfortable, loose shape. The neckline is shaped by working short rows after having worked the ribbed edge.
As the sweater is worked from the top down, you can try on the sweater as your work progresses.

SIZES
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)

MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 106 (112) 116 (120) 126 (136) 146 (152) cm 41.75 (44) 45.5 (47.25) 49.5 (53.5) 57.5 (59.5) inches
Length, center back below the neckline: 55 (56) 58 (60) 61 (62) 63 (64) cm 21.5 (22) 22.75 (23.5) 24 (24.25) 24.75 (25) inches

SIZE GUIDE
Sweater No. 9 should be worked with a positive ease of approx. 20-25 cm 8-9.75 inches.
Measure yourself before you begin to ensure that you choose the correct size.
The sizes suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm 31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51 (51-55) inches.
For example: Your bust circumference is 89 cm 35 inches + 20-25 cm 8-9.75 inches = 109-114 cm 43-44.75 inches. Meaning you would choose a size S with a circumference of 112 cm 44 inches.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
3.5 mm US 4 circular needles (40 cm 16 inches)
4 mm US 6 circular needles (40 and 80, 100 or 120 cm 16 and 32, 40 or 48 inches)

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 4 mm US 6 needles.

20 sts / 28 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches

MATERIALS
450 (500) 550 (550) 600 (600) 650 (700) gr.
Pura Lana, Gepard Garn, 50 gr. / 115 m.
Shown in colour 780, Marine blue.

Work your sweater using a single strand of the suggested yarn.

users.about_me:
Behind My Favourite Things you'll meet Louise. 
Louise has been working in the Danish fashion industry for more than a decade, and has been taking part in developing and growing well-known designer brands for years.  

From the very beginning of MFTK, Louise's main focus has been to create classic and timeless wardrobe favourites of high quality, that lasts for more than a season: simple but aesthetically pleasing designs with thought out details, always aiming for 'the perfect fit'. 

Louise says; 'After more than a decade in the fashion industry, I experienced a saturation of overconsumption and mass production. I felt a need to go back to my roots, crafting my wardrobe with my own hands.
I was frustrated to see how collections became outdated almost before they hit the stores, and wanted to create something more long-lasting. 
This is how the idea of MFTK came to life.
I've taken the advantage of my many years of experience within fashion and design and created a brand of timeless knitwear without an expiry date.'

At MFTK you'll find knitting patterns at all different stages of difficulty. The patterns are written in a precise and straight forward language, making MFTK a great choice for both brand new and more experienced knitters. The wide range of patterns allows you to develop your personal knitting skills elevate to the next level.

You can follow the universe of the brand at Instagram @myfavouritethings.knitwear.

If you have questions, comments or concerns, you are welcome to write us a message at support@mftknitwear.com. 
We are a very small team, so please have patience with us. 

Welcome!

name: Cherry Tart
gauge_description: 25 stitches and 39 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
If you purchase 5 or more patterns from my Ravelry Store at the same time (be sure to add them all to your cart before checking out), you will automatically receive a 25% discount.

Cherry Tart pullover is seamless; it is worked top down and in the round. First, the shoulder panels are knit, then back and front stitches are picked up from the panels edges, and worked separately until underarms. They are joined in the round, and the body is worked until the desired length. Neckband and sleeves stitches are picked up from the edge of the body and worked in the round.

Sizes (finished bust measurements)
32 (36, 40, 44, 48), (52, 56, 60, 64)“ / 81 (91, 102, 112, 122), (132, 142, 152, 163) cm
It is recommended to choose a size with positive ease 4”-6”/ 10-15 cm.
The sample is shown with positive ease 6”/ 15 cm.

Yarn
Malabrigo Yarn Arroyo, 334 yards/3.5 oz (305 m/100 g) in color Cereza (33):
4 (4, 5, 5, 5), (6, 6, 7, 7) skeins.
Approximately 1108 (1245, 1395, 1532, 1669), (1806, 1943, 2079, 2230) yards/ 1013 (1138, 1275, 1400, 1525), (1650, 1775, 1900, 2038) meters of yarn in sport weight.

notes:
> If you purchase 5 or more patterns
> from my Ravelry Store at the same time
> (be sure to add them all to your cart
> before checking out), you will
> automatically receive a 25% discount.

*Cherry Tart pullover is seamless; it is worked top down and in the round. First, the shoulder panels are knit, then back and front stitches are picked up from the panels edges, and worked separately until underarms. They are joined in the round, and the body is worked until the desired length. Neckband and sleeves stitches are picked up from the edge of the body and worked in the round.* 

**Sizes (finished bust measurements)** 
32 (36, 40, 44, 48), (52, 56, 60, 64)" / 81 (91, 102, 112, 122), (132, 142, 152, 163) cm 
It is recommended to choose a size with positive ease 4”-6”/ 10-15 cm.
The sample is shown with positive ease 6”/ 15 cm.

**Yarn**
Malabrigo Yarn Arroyo, 334 yards/3.5 oz (305 m/100 g) in color Cereza (33): 
4 (4, 5, 5, 5), (6, 6, 7, 7) skeins.
Approximately 1108 (1245, 1395, 1532, 1669), (1806, 1943, 2079, 2230) yards/ 1013 (1138, 1275, 1400, 1525), (1650, 1775, 1900, 2038) meters of yarn in sport weight.


#sizeinclusive

name: Sweater No. 14
gauge_description: 15 stitches and 19 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Sweater No. 14 is inspired by the oversize silhouettes in fashion.

The sweater is oversize with extra long sleeves, which create the perfect boyfriend fit. The shape is asymmetrical, where the back is longer than the front.

It is worked top down in one piece.

SIZES

1 (2) 3

MEASUREMENTS

Length (measured at the centre front below the neck trim): 52 (54) 57 cm 20.5 (21.25) 22.5 inches

Circumference: 112 (123) 141 cm 44 (48.5) 55.5 inches

SUGGESTED NEEDLES

6 mm US 10 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)

5 mm US 8 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)

4 mm US 6 circular needles (40 or 80 cm 16 or 32 inches)

GAUGE

In stocking stitch using 6 mm US 10 needles.

15 sts / 19 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches.

MATERIALS

300 (300) 300 gr. Pelsuld 8/2, Hjelholt Uldspinderi, 100 gr. / 400 m.

Shown in colour ‘Lys Grå’.

held together with…

200 (200) 250 gr. Soft Silk Mohair, Knitting for Olive 25 gr. / 225 m.

Shown in colours ‘Perlegrå/Pearl Grey’ and ‘Havre/Oat’ (100 (100) 125 gr. of each colour).

Work the sweater using three strands of yarn held together. One strand of Pelsuld 8/2 and two strands of Soft Silk Mohair.

users.about_me:
Behind My Favourite Things you'll meet Louise. 
Louise has been working in the Danish fashion industry for more than a decade, and has been taking part in developing and growing well-known designer brands for years.  

From the very beginning of MFTK, Louise's main focus has been to create classic and timeless wardrobe favourites of high quality, that lasts for more than a season: simple but aesthetically pleasing designs with thought out details, always aiming for 'the perfect fit'. 

Louise says; 'After more than a decade in the fashion industry, I experienced a saturation of overconsumption and mass production. I felt a need to go back to my roots, crafting my wardrobe with my own hands.
I was frustrated to see how collections became outdated almost before they hit the stores, and wanted to create something more long-lasting. 
This is how the idea of MFTK came to life.
I've taken the advantage of my many years of experience within fashion and design and created a brand of timeless knitwear without an expiry date.'

At MFTK you'll find knitting patterns at all different stages of difficulty. The patterns are written in a precise and straight forward language, making MFTK a great choice for both brand new and more experienced knitters. The wide range of patterns allows you to develop your personal knitting skills elevate to the next level.

You can follow the universe of the brand at Instagram @myfavouritethings.knitwear.

If you have questions, comments or concerns, you are welcome to write us a message at support@mftknitwear.com. 
We are a very small team, so please have patience with us. 

Welcome!

name: Sweater No. 30 V-neck
gauge_description: 16 stitches and 23 rows = 4 inches in Stocking stitch
notes_html:
Sweater No. 30 V-Neck is an oversized sweater with a V-neckline, featuring saddle shoulders, and distinctive details. The back and yoke are shaped with short rows to ensure a good fit. The sleeves are wide at the top and taper at the cuffs. The sweater is unisex and can be worn by all genders.
It is worked from the top down, allowing you to try it on as you go and adjust it to your measurements.

SIZES
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)

MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 113 (118) 128 (135) 140 (145) 155 (163) cm 44.5 (46.5) 50.5 (53.25) 55 (57) 61 (64.25) inches
Length (measured at the center back): 54 (55) 57 (58) 60 (61) 62 (63) cm 21.25 (21.75) 22.5 (22.75) 23.5 (24) 24.5 (24.75) inches

Size guide
Sweater No. 30 V-neck has an oversized fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 30-35 cm 11.75-13.75 inches for sizes XS-XL and approx. 20-25 cm 7.75-9.75 inches for sizes 2XL-4XL. The positive ease is designed to provide the most flattering fit for each size.
Sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) correspond to European standard sizes and fit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm 31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.25) 39.25-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches.
For example: If your bust circumference is 88 cm 34.75 inches, you should add 30-35 cm 11.75-13.75 inches = 118-123 cm 46.5-48.5 inches. Therefore, you should make size S with a finished circumference of 118 cm 46.75 inches.

The model is wearing size S.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
5 mm US 8 circular needles (80 or 100 cm) 32 or 40 inches
4.5 mm US 7 circular needles (80 or 100 cm) 32 or 40 inches
4 mm US 6 circular needles (80 or 100 cm) 32 or 40 inches

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 5 mm US 8 needles.

16 sts / 23 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches.

The given gauge is measured after washing and blocking.

MATERIALS
400 (450) 500 (500) 550 (600) 650 (650) gr Woolia, Gepard, 50 gr / 133 m.

held together with…

75 (100) 100 (100) 100-125 (125) 125 (125) gr Cashmere Lace, Gepard, 25 gr / 350 m.

Work the sweater holding 2 strands together, 1 strand of Woolia and 1 strand of Cashmere Lace.

or…

450 (500) 550 (600) 600 (650) 700 (750) gr Pura Lana, Gepard, 50 gr / 115 m.

held together with…

75 (100) 100 (100) 100-125 (125) 125 (125) gr Cashmere Lace, Gepard, 25 gr / 350 m.

Work the sweater holding 2 strands together, 1 strand of Pura Lana and 1 strand of Cashmere Lace.

or…

300 (325) 375 (375) 400 (425) 475 (500) gr My Soft One, Gepard, 25 gr / 90 m.

held together with…

125 (150) 150 (175) 175 (175) 200 (200) gr Kid Seta, Gepard, 25 gr / 212 m.

Work the sweater holding 2 strands together, 1 strand of My Soft One together with 1 strand of Kid Seta.

It is worked from the top down, allowing you to try it on as you go and adjust it to your measurements.

name: Sweater No. 26
gauge_description: 19 stitches and 27 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Sweater No. 26 is a short, oversize sweater with defined saddle shoulders, which add character and catch the eye. The yoke is shaped by working short rows, which ensure a good fit. The sleeves, shaped using the contiguous method, are wide at the armhole and narrow in at the wrist.
The neat neckline and twisted rib edges add a feminine contrast to an otherwise masculine impression.

SIZES
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)

MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 107 (112) 118 (126) 133 (139) 145 (152) cm 42 (44) 46.5 (49.5) 52.5 (54.75) 57 (59.5) inches
Length (measured at the center back): 50 (51) 53 (54) 56 (58) 60 (62) cm 19.75 (20) 21 (21.25) 22 (23) 23.5 (24.5) inches

Size guide
Sweater No. 26 has an oversize fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 20-25 cm 8-10 inches in sizes XS-XL and approx. 15-20 cm 6-8 inches in sizes 2XL-4XL. The suggested positive ease is determined with the aim of providing the best fit in each size.
Sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) are equivalent to European standard sizing and suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm 31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches.

Ie.: You measure 88 cm 34.75 inches at your bust + 20-25 cm 8-10 inches = 108-113 cm 42.75 - 44.75 inches. Meaning you would choose a size S with a finished circumference of 112 cm 44 inches.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
5 mm US 8 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
4 mm US 6 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
3 mm US 3 circular needles (40, 80 or 100 cm 16, 32 or 40 inches)

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 5 mm US 8 needles.

19 sts / 27 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches.

MATERIALS
450 (500) 500 (550) 600 (600) 650 (700) gr Pura Lana, Gepard, 115 m / 50 gr

held together with…

75 (75) 100 (100) 100 (125) 125 (125) gr Cashmere Lace, Gepard, 350 m / 25 gr

Work the sweater holding two strands of yarn together. One strand of Pura Lana, one strand of Cashmere Lace.

The neat neckline and twisted rib edges add a feminine contrast to an otherwise masculine impression.

gauge_pattern: stockinette stitch with one strand of each yarn held together on size 4 mm needles
name: No Frills Sweater
gauge_description: 21 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch with one strand of each yarn held together on size 4 mm needles
notes_html:
No Frills Sweater is a simple raglan sweater with neckline shaping at the front. The fit is slightly oversized, but the wide rib edges and the shorter length give the sweater a feminine silhouette. The No Frills Sweater is worked from the top down, which makes it easy to try it on along the way, so you can customize it to fit your body and end up with the perfect sleeve and body length for you. If you want to make sure that the rib neck edge keeps it shape over time, you can sew a thin elastic thread along the edge.
Start by knitting a swatch to determine which needle size gives you the correct gauge.

Size guide
The No Frills Sweater is designed to have approx. 15 cm [6 inches] of positive ease, meaning it is designed to be 15 cm [6 inches] larger in circumference than your chest measurement. The sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL are designed to fit a chest circumference of 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 cm [31½-33½ (33½-35½) 35½-37½ (37½-39½) 39½-43¼ (43¼-47¼) 47¼-51¼ inches]. The measurements for the finished garment are on the front page of the pattern (note that these measurements are only achieved if the sweater is knitted in the correct gauge). Before beginning your project, measure yourself with a measuring tape around your bust (or your widest upper body part) to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 93 cm [36½ inches] around your bust (or around the widest part on your upper body) you should knit a size M. A size M sweater has a bust circumference of 108 cm [42½ inches], which in the given example would give you 15 cm [6 inches] of positive ease.

Sizes:
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL

Bust circumference:
100 (104) 108 (114) 120 (130) 137 cm
[39¼ (41) 42½ (45) 47¼ (51¼) 54 inches]

Sleeve circumference:
36 (39) 41 (44) 46 (46) 47 cm
[14¼ (15¼) 16¼ (17¼) 18 (18) 18½ inches]

Length mid back:
52 (54) 55 (56) 58 (60) 62 cm
[20½ (21¼) 21¾ (22) 22¾ (23½) 24½ inches]

Gauge:
21 sts x 28 rows in stockinette stitch on 4 mm needles = 10 x 10 cm [4 x 4 inches], after blocking

Needles:
Circular needles: 3 mm [US2½] and 4 mm [US6] / 40 and 80 or 100 cm [16 and 32 or 40 inches]
Double-pointed needles: 3 mm [US2½] and 4 mm [US6]

Yarn:
250 (250) 300 (300) 350 (350) 350-400 g Sunday by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 235 m [257 yds]) or Arwetta by Filcolana (50 g = 210 m [230 yds]) held together with 125 (125) 150 (150) 175 (175) 175-200 g Tilia by Filcolana (25 g = 210 m v) or Tynn Silk Mohair by Sandnes Garn (25 g = 212 m [232 yds])

Difficulty: ★ ★ ★ (3 out of 5)

See the classification of difficulty here.

The white No Frills Sweater is knitted in Sunday by Sandnes Garn in the color Whipped cream [1012] held together with Tynn Silk Mohair by Sandnes Garn in the color Natur [1012].

The speckled No Frills Sweater is knitted in Tosh Merino Light by Madelinetosh in the color Modern Fair Isle held together with Tilia by Filcolana in the color Råhvid [101].
notes:
No Frills Sweater is a simple raglan sweater with neckline shaping at the front. The fit is slightly oversized, but the wide rib edges and the shorter length give the sweater a feminine silhouette. The No Frills Sweater is worked from the top down, which makes it easy to try it on along the way, so you can customize it to fit your body and end up with the perfect sleeve and body length for you. If you want to make sure that the rib neck edge keeps it shape over time, you can sew a thin elastic thread along the edge. 
Start by knitting a swatch to determine which needle size gives you the correct gauge.

**Size guide**
The No Frills Sweater is designed to have approx. 15 cm \[6 inches\] of positive ease, meaning it is designed to be 15 cm \[6 inches\] larger in circumference than your chest measurement. The sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL are designed to fit a chest circumference of 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 cm \[31½-33½ (33½-35½) 35½-37½ (37½-39½) 39½-43¼ (43¼-47¼) 47¼-51¼ inches\]. The measurements for the finished garment are on the front page of the pattern (note that these measurements are only achieved if the sweater is knitted in the correct gauge). Before beginning your project, measure yourself with a measuring tape around your bust (or your widest upper body part) to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 93 cm \[36½ inches\] around your bust (or around the widest part on your upper body) you should knit a size M. A size M sweater has a bust circumference of 108 cm \[42½ inches\], which in the given example would give you 15 cm \[6 inches\] of positive ease.

**Sizes:** 
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL

**Bust circumference:** 
100 (104) 108 (114) 120 (130) 137 cm 
\[39¼ (41) 42½ (45) 47¼ (51¼) 54 inches\]

**Sleeve circumference:** 
36 (39) 41 (44) 46 (46) 47 cm 
\[14¼ (15¼) 16¼ (17¼) 18 (18) 18½ inches\]

**Length mid back:** 
52 (54) 55 (56) 58 (60) 62 cm 
\[20½ (21¼) 21¾ (22) 22¾ (23½) 24½ inches\]

**Gauge:** 
21 sts x 28 rows in stockinette stitch on 4 mm needles = 10 x 10 cm \[4 x 4 inches\], after blocking

**Needles:** 
*Circular needles*: 3 mm \[US2½\] and 4 mm \[US6\] / 40 and 80 or 100 cm \[16 and 32 or 40 inches\]
*Double-pointed needles*: 3 mm \[US2½\] and 4 mm \[US6\]

**Yarn:** 
250 (250) 300 (300) 350 (350) 350-400 g Sunday by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 235 m \[257 yds\]) **or** Arwetta by Filcolana (50 g = 210 m \[230 yds\]) **held together with** 125 (125) 150 (150) 175 (175) 175-200 g Tilia by Filcolana (25 g = 210 m v) **or** Tynn Silk Mohair by Sandnes Garn (25 g = 212 m \[232 yds\])

**Difficulty**: ★ ★ ★ (3 out of 5)

See the classification of difficulty [here][1].

The white No Frills Sweater is knitted in Sunday by Sandnes Garn in the color Whipped cream \[1012\] held together with Tynn Silk Mohair by Sandnes Garn in the color Natur \[1012\].

The speckled No Frills Sweater is knitted in Tosh Merino Light by Madelinetosh in the color Modern Fair Isle held together with Tilia by Filcolana in the color Råhvid \[101\].

  [1]: https://petiteknit.myshopify.com/pages/degree-of-difficulty

gauge_pattern: in colorwork pattern and stockinette stitch on larger needles
name: Key Sweater
gauge_description: 18 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in colorwork pattern and stockinette stitch on larger needles
notes_html:
The Key Sweater is worked from the top down with raglan increases on the yoke. Short rows are worked after the neck rib edge to shape the neckline. The body and sleeves are worked in the round and finished with rib edges. The pattern is knitted with a two-colour stripe pattern.

Size Guide
The Key Sweater is designed to have approx. 25 cm [9¾ inches] of positive ease, meaning it is designed to be approx. 25 cm [9¾ inches] larger in circumference than your bust measurement. The sizes XXS (XS) S (M) L (XL) 2XL (3XL) 4XL (5XL) are designed to fit a bust circumference of 75-80 (80-85) 85-90 (90-95) 95-100 (100-110) 110-120 (120-130) 130-140 (140-150) cm [29½-31½ (31½-33½) 33½-35½ (35½-37½) 37½-39½ (39½-43¼) 43¼-47¼ (47¼-51¼) 51¼-55 (55-59) inches]. The measurements for the finished sweater can be found on the front page of the pattern. Measure yourself before beginning your project, to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 86 cm [33¾ inches] around your bust (or around the widest part of your upper body) you should knit a size XS. A size XS sweater has a bust circumference of 111 cm [43¾ inches] which in the given example would give you 25 cm [9¾ inches] of positive ease.

(measured mid back excl. neck edge)

18 sts x 24 rows = 10 x 10 cm [4 x 4 inches] in colorwork pattern and stockinette stitch on a 4.5 mm\ US7] needle

Needles:
Circular needles: 4 mm [US6] / 40 and 80 or 100 cm [16 and 32 or 40 inches] and 4.5 mm [US7] / 40, 60 and 80 or 100 cm [16, 24 and 32 or 40 inches];
Double-pointed needles: 4 mm [US6] and 4.5 mm [US7] (unless the Magic Loop technique is used)

Materials:

gauge_pattern: stockinette stitch with both yarns held together,, see notes
name: Sweater No. 11 Light
gauge_description: 20 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch with both yarns held together,, see notes
notes_html:
Sweater No. 11 light is a classic, oversized sweater, which fits perfectly into any wardrobe. Few, but important, details catch the eye and at the same time ensure a great fit. The sweater is slightly asymmetric with extra length on the back. The sweater is worked from the top down without any additional seaming.

SIZES
XS, (S, M, L, 1X, 2X, 3X, 4X)

MEASUREMENTS
Length (measured at the center front below the neckline): 45 (47) 49 (51) 55 (59) 62 (64) cm 17.75 (18.5) 19.25 (20) 21.75 (23.25) 24.5 (25.25) inches
Circumference: 120 (126) 132 (136) 140 (146) 156 (166) cm 47.25 (49.50) 52 (53.5) 55 (57.5) 61.5 (65.25) inches

Size guide
Sweater No. 11 light has an oversized fit. The smaller sizes have a larger positive ease than the larger, to compliment each body in the best possible way. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 35-40 cm [13.75-15.75 inches] in sizes XS-XL and 30-35 cm [11.75-13.75 inches] in sizes 2XL-4XL.
Sizes XS, (S, M, L, 1X, 2X, 3X, 4X) are equivalent to European standard sizes and suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm [31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches].

For example: You measure 88 cm [34.75 inches] at your bust + 35-40 cm [13.75-15.75 inches]= 123-128 cm [48.5-50.5 inches]. Meaning you would choose a size S with a finished circumference of 126 cm [49.5 inches].

Model wears size M (black version).
Model wears size XS (light version).

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
4 mm US 6 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
3.5 mm US 4 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
3 mm US 2.5r 80 cm 16 or 32 inches)

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 4 mm US 6 needles
20 sts / 28 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches

MATERIALS
300 (300) 400 (400) 400 (500) 500 (500) gr. Pelsuld 8/2, Hjelholts Uldspinderi, 100 gr. / 400 m.
Shown in col. ‘Black’.

held together with…

125 (150) 150 (175) 175 (200) 200 (225) gr. Soft Silk Mohair, Knitting for Olive, 25 gr. / 225 m.

or…

125 (150) 150 (175) 175 (200) 200 (225) gr. Silk Mohair, Isager, 25 gr. / 212 m.
Shown in col. 30 ‘Black’.

Work the sweater holding two strands of yarn together. One strand of Pelsuld and one strand of silk mohair.

or…

450 (500) 550 (600) 600 (650) 700 (750) gr. Jensen, Isager, 50 gr. / 125 m.

Use a single strand of yarn.

users.about_me:
Behind My Favourite Things you'll meet Louise. 
Louise has been working in the Danish fashion industry for more than a decade, and has been taking part in developing and growing well-known designer brands for years.  

From the very beginning of MFTK, Louise's main focus has been to create classic and timeless wardrobe favourites of high quality, that lasts for more than a season: simple but aesthetically pleasing designs with thought out details, always aiming for 'the perfect fit'. 

Louise says; 'After more than a decade in the fashion industry, I experienced a saturation of overconsumption and mass production. I felt a need to go back to my roots, crafting my wardrobe with my own hands.
I was frustrated to see how collections became outdated almost before they hit the stores, and wanted to create something more long-lasting. 
This is how the idea of MFTK came to life.
I've taken the advantage of my many years of experience within fashion and design and created a brand of timeless knitwear without an expiry date.'

At MFTK you'll find knitting patterns at all different stages of difficulty. The patterns are written in a precise and straight forward language, making MFTK a great choice for both brand new and more experienced knitters. The wide range of patterns allows you to develop your personal knitting skills elevate to the next level.

You can follow the universe of the brand at Instagram @myfavouritethings.knitwear.

If you have questions, comments or concerns, you are welcome to write us a message at support@mftknitwear.com. 
We are a very small team, so please have patience with us. 

Welcome!

gauge_pattern: in texture pattern on larger needles
name: Moby Sweater
gauge_description: 20 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in texture pattern on larger needles
notes_html:
The Moby Sweater is worked from the top down in a texture and cable pattern. First the back yoke is worked and shaped using short rows to form the slope of the shoulders. After this, stitches are picked up and knitted for each shoulder, which are then joined to form the front yoke. The front and back yoke are joined to form the body, which is worked straight down in the round. The sleeves are worked in the round on double-pointed needles or on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. Finally, stitches are picked up at the neckline to work a ribbed edge, which is then folded over towards the inside to form a double neckband, which is closed by knitting the stitches together with the pick-up edge.

Knit a swatch to determine which needle size you need to achieve the correct gauge – note that this can vary from yarn to yarn. Take care to wash the swatch before measuring, as the texture pattern can grow with wash.

Size guide
The Moby Sweater is designed to have approx. 15-20 cm [6-8 inches] of positive ease, meaning it is designed to be approx. 15-20 cm [6-8 inches] larger in circumference than your bust measurement. The sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) 5XL are designed to fit a bust circumference of 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100)
100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) 140-150 cm [30½-33½ (33½-35½) 35½-37½ (37½-39½) 39½-43¼ (43¼-47¼) 47¼-51¼ (51¼-55) 55-59 inches].

The measurements for the finished garment are given on the first page of the pattern. Before beginning your project, measure yourself to determine which size will fit you the best. A size S sweater has a bust circumference of 106 cm [41¾ inches] which in the given example would give you 16 cm [6¼ inches] of positive ease.

After this, stitches are picked up and knitted for each shoulder, which are then joined to form the front yoke. The front and back yoke are joined to form the body, which is worked straight down in the round. The sleeves are worked in the round on double-pointed needles or on a circular needle using the Magic Loop technique. Finally, stitches are picked up at the neckline to work a ribbed edge, which is then folded over towards the inside to form a double neckband, which is closed by knitting the stitches together with the pick-up edge.

name: Edinburgh Seamless Dog Sweater
gauge_description: 18 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Description
The Edinburgh Seamless Dog Sweater is worked from neck to tail with a single piece of yarn, using raglan increases.  This sweater’s longer design works particularly well for mini and standard dachshunds, but the pattern can easily be altered to fit dogs of different shapes and sizes.  

This sweater comes in six sizes.

Video Tutorial
You can also find a video tutorial for this sweater on my YouTube channel: https://youtu.be/fgO-t8YM2y8

Yarn
I used Premier Anti-Pilling Everyday Worsted in Steel and Mist and Bernat Premium Tweeds in Aran Tweed (as seen in the photos), but any worsted weight yarn will work.

Needles
For sizes XXS, XS, S:
Circular needles: 5 mm US8 / 30 cm 12 inches & 4 mm US6 23 cm 9 inches or 
Double-pointed needles: 5mm US8 4 mm US6

For sizes M, L, XL:
Circular needles: 5 mm US8 / 40 cm 16 inches & 4 mm US6 30 cm 12 inches or 
Double-pointed needles: 5mm US8 4 mm US6

If you prefer a raglan dog sweater with sleeves, check out the Portland Raglan Dog Sweater.

name: Ingrid Sweater
gauge_description: 20 stitches and 30 rows = 4 inches in texture pattern on 4 mm needles after wash and blocking
notes_html:
The Ingrid Sweater is worked from the top down in a knit and purl texture pattern. First, the back yoke is worked back and forth and the sloping shoulders are shaped using short rows. Then stitches are picked up and knitted for the shoulder sections, which are also shaped using short rows. The shoulder sections are then joined to form the front yoke. The front and back yoke are joined at the underarms to form the body, which is worked straight down in the round. The sleeves are knitted in the round from stitches that are picked up and knitted along the armholes. The Ingrid Sweater is worked in a texture pattern, which consists of three different pattern sections, each one separated by an eyelet section.

Begin by knitting a swatch to determine which needle size you need to achieve the correct gauge before starting the project – note that the gauge needs to be correct both in width and height, for you to be able to achieve the measurements given at the top of the pattern.

Size guide
The Ingrid Sweater is designed to have approx. 20 cm [8 inches] of positive ease, meaning it is designed to be approx. 20 cm [8 inches] larger in circumference than your bust measurement. The sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) 5XL are designed to fit a bust circumference of 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) 140-150 cm [30½-33½ (33½-35½) 35½-37½ (37½-39½) 39½-43¼ (43¼-47¼) 47¼-51¼ (51¼-55) 55-59 inches].

The measurements for the finished garment are given on the first page of the pattern. Before beginning your project, measure yourself to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 90 cm 35½ inches around your bust (or around the widest part on your upper body) you should knit a size S. A size S sweater has a bust circumference of 112 cm 44 inches, which in the given example would give you 22 cm 8½ inches of positive ease.

The grey Ingrid Sweater is knitted in Pelsuld 5,5/2 by Hjelholts Uldspinderi in the color Grå [01] held together with Silk Mohair by Isager in color 3S.

name: Sonja Sweater
gauge_description: 17 stitches and 24 rows = 4 inches in stockinette on larger needles
notes_html:
The Sonja Sweater is worked from the top down in stockinette stitch. First, the top part of the back yoke is worked flat. Then, stitches for the shoulders are picked up and knitted along the cast-on edge of the back yoke. The shoulders are shaped using short rows. The front and back yoke are joined at the underarms and the body is worked in the round on a circular needle. Stitches are then picked up and knitted along the underarms for the sleeves, which are worked in the round. At the end, stitches are picked up and knitted along the neck edge, where a ribbed edge is first worked and then folded over to the inside and knitted down on the wrong side. The Sonja Sweater does not require any finishing.

Begin by knitting a swatch to determine which needle size will give you the correct gauge.

Size guide
The Sonja Sweater is designed to have approx. 30 cm [11¾ inches] of positive ease in the smaller sizes and then gradually less positive ease in the larger sizes. The sizes XXS (XS) S (M) L (XL) 2XL (3XL) 4XL (5XL) are designed to fit a bust circumference of 75-80 (80-85) 85-90 (90-95) 95-100 (100-110) 110-120 (120-130) 130-140 (140-150) cm [29½-31½ (31½-33½) 33½-35½ (35½-37½) 37½-39½ (39½-43¼) 43¼-47¼ (47¼-51¼) 51¼-55 (55-59) inches].

The measurements for the finished sweater are listed on the front page of the pattern. Please note that these measurements are only achieved if the correct gauge is maintained while knitting. Measure yourself before starting your project, to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 90 cm [35½ inches] around your bust (or around the widest part of your upper body) you should knit a size S. A size S sweater has a bust circumference of 120 cm [47¼ inches] which in the given example would give you 30 cm 11¾ inches of positive ease.

Sizes:
XXS (XS) S (M) L (XL) 2XL (3XL) 4XL (5XL)

110 (115) 120 (124) 128 (134) 138 (144) 154 (160) cm
[43¾ (45¾) 47¼ (48¾) 50½ (52¾) 54¼ (56¾) 60¾ (63) inches]

Length:
58 (59) 60 (62) 64 (65) 66 (69) 72 (76) cm
[22¾ (23¼) 23½ (24½) 25¼ (25½) 26 (27¼) 28¼ (30) inches]

Gauge:
17 sts x 24 rows = 10 x 10 cm [4 x 4 inches] in stockinette stitch on a 5 mm [US8] needle

Needles:
Circular needles: 5 mm [US8] / 40, 60, 80 and/or 100 cm [16, 24, 32 and/or 40 inches], 4.5 mm [US7] / 80 or 100 cm [32 or 40 inche\s] and 4 mm US6 / 40 cm [16 inches]
Double-pointed needles: 5 mm [US8] and 4.5 mm [US7]

Materials:
Suggestion 1: 500 (500) 600 (600) 600 (600) 700 (700) 700 (800) g Håndværksgarn by Hjelholt Uldspinderi (100 g = 200 m 219 yds)

Suggestion 2: 550 (550-600) 600 (650) 650 (700) 750 (750-800) 800 (850) g Peer Gynt by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 91 m [98 yds]) held together with 150 (150) 150 (150) 150 (150) 200 (200) 200 (200) g Alpakka Følgetråd by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 400 m [437 yds])

The dark grey Sonja Sweater is knitted in Håndværksgarn by Hjelholts Uldspinderi in color Mørk grå [04].

Stitches are then picked up and knitted along the underarms for the sleeves, which are worked in the round. Begin by knitting a swatch to determine which needle size will give you the correct gauge. 

**Size guide**
The Sonja Sweater is designed to have approx. 30 cm \[11¾ inches\] of positive ease in the smaller sizes and then gradually less positive ease in the larger sizes. The sizes XXS (XS) S (M) L (XL) 2XL (3XL) 4XL (5XL) are designed to fit a bust circumference of 75-80 (80-85) 85-90 (90-95) 95-100 (100-110) 110-120 (120-130) 130-140 (140-150) cm \[29½-31½ (31½-33½) 33½-35½ (35½-37½) 37½-39½ (39½-43¼) 43¼-47¼ (47¼-51¼) 51¼-55 (55-59) inches\]. 

The measurements for the finished sweater are listed on the front page of the pattern. Please note that these measurements are only achieved if the correct gauge is maintained while knitting. Measure yourself before starting your project, to determine which size will fit you the best. For example, if you measure 90 cm \[35½ inches\] around your bust (or around the widest part of your upper body) you should knit a size S. A size S sweater has a bust circumference of 120 cm \[47¼ inches\] which in the given example would give you 30 cm [11¾ inches] of positive ease.

**Sizes:** 
XXS (XS) S (M) L (XL) 2XL (3XL) 4XL (5XL)

**Bust circumference:** 
110 (115) 120 (124) 128 (134) 138 (144) 154 (160) cm
\[43¾ (45¾) 47¼ (48¾) 50½ (52¾) 54¼ (56¾) 60¾ (63) inches\]

**Length:** 
58 (59) 60 (62) 64 (65) 66 (69) 72 (76) cm 
\[22¾ (23¼) 23½ (24½) 25¼ (25½) 26 (27¼) 28¼ (30) inches\]

**Gauge:** 
17 sts x 24 rows = 10 x 10 cm \[4 x 4 inches\] in stockinette stitch on a 5 mm \[US8\] needle 

**Needles:** 
**Circular needles:** 5 mm \[US8\] / 40, 60, 80 and/or 100 cm \[16, 24, 32 and/or 40 inches\], 4.5 mm \[US7\] / 80 or 100 cm \[32 or 40 inche\s] and 4 mm [US6] / 40 cm \[16 inches\]
**Double-pointed needles:** 5 mm \[US8\] and 4.5 mm \[US7\] 

**Materials:** 
**Suggestion 1:** 500 (500) 600 (600) 600 (600) 700 (700) 700 (800) g Håndværksgarn by Hjelholt Uldspinderi (100 g = 200 m [219 yds]) 

**Suggestion 2:** 550 (550-600) 600 (650) 650 (700) 750 (750-800) 800 (850) g Peer Gynt by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 91 m \[98 yds\]) held together with 150 (150) 150 (150) 150 (150) 200 (200) 200 (200) g Alpakka Følgetråd by Sandnes Garn (50 g = 400 m \[437 yds\])

**Difficulty:** ★ ★ ★ ★ (4 out of 5)

See the classification of [difficulty here.][1] 

The light grey Sonja Sweater is knitted in Håndværksgarn by Hjelholts Uldspinderi in color Havskum \[30\].

The dark grey Sonja Sweater is knitted in Håndværksgarn by Hjelholts Uldspinderi in color Mørk grå \[04\].


  [1]: https://www.petiteknit.com/en/pages/svaerhedsgrad

gauge_pattern: stockinette stitch with larger needles, see notes
name: Tain
gauge_description: 18 stitches and 28 rows = 4 inches in stockinette stitch with larger needles, see notes
notes_html:
Tain is a top-down, raglan sweater with dramatic Half Fisherman’s Rib at the raglan, under the arm and down the sleeve. It is oversized and cosy but has chic detailing. 

SIZES 
1 (2, 3, 4, 5) (6, 7, 8, 9)

Recommended ease: 6–7.75” / 15–20 cm of positive ease.

FINISHED MEASUREMENTS
Chest Circumference: 33.25 (37.5, 43, 47.25, 51.5) (57, 61.25, 66.5, 70.75)“ / 84.5 (95.5, 109, 120, 131) (145, 156, 169, 180) cm.

Back Yoke Depth (from centre of back neck CO edge, not incl. collar): 7.25 (7.5, 8.25, 8.25, 8.5) (9, 9, 9.5, 9.75)“ / 18.5 (19.5, 20.5, 20.5, 21.5) (23, 23, 24, 24.5) cm.

Body Length (from underarm): 12.5” / 32 cm.

Armhole Depth: 8.5 (8.75, 9.25, 9.5, 9.75) (10.5, 10.75, 11.25, 11.25)“ / 21.5 (22.5, 24, 24.5, 25) (26.5, 27, 28.5, 29) cm.

Upper Arm Circumference: 12.25 (13.25, 15, 15.75, 16.5) (19, 20, 22.25, 23.25)“ / 31 (33.5, 38, 40, 42) (48, 51, 56.5, 59) cm.

Sleeve Length (from underarm): 17.25” / 44 cm.

MATERIALS 
Yarn: 5 (5, 6, 7, 7) (8, 9, 9, 10) balls of Wooldreamers Mota (50% Spanish Merino Entrefino Wool, 50% Manchega Wool, 252 yds / 230 m – 100 g), in the colourway 463.

Or approx. 1090 (1230, 1420, 1530, 1710) (1890, 2100, 2250, 2386) yds / 1000 (1125, 1300, 1400, 1550) (1725, 1900, 2050, 2150) m of a similar woolen-spun DK-weight yarn.

Alternative yarn suggestions are for example Peer Gynt by Sandnes Garn or The Croft Aran by West Yorkshire Spinners.

Needles: US 6 / 4 mm and US 5 / 3.75 mm (for ribbing) circular needles.

Notions: 7 stitch markers and 1 BOR marker, scrap yarn or stitch holders.

GAUGE
18 sts and 28 rows to 4” / 10 cm on US 6 / 4 mm needles in both St St and Half Fisherman’s Rib, after blocking.

CONSTRUCTION
Stitches are first cast on for the neck and short rows are worked to raise the back. The yoke is worked in the round with increases made at the raglan points. The raglans are worked in Half Fisherman’s Rib.  At the bottom of the yoke the body is split from the sleeves. The body is worked with Half Fisherman’s Rib under the arms and finished with a deep ribbed hem. The sleeves also have Half Fisherman’s Rib under the arm. Stitches are picked up for the collar and worked in Half Fisherman’s Rib.

Or approx. 1090 (1230, 1420, 1530, 1710) (1890, 2100, 2250, 2386) yds / 1000 (1125, 1300, 1400, 1550) (1725, 1900, 2050, 2150) m of a similar woolen-spun DK-weight yarn.  

Alternative yarn suggestions are for example Peer Gynt by Sandnes Garn or The Croft Aran by West Yorkshire Spinners.

The body is worked with Half Fisherman’s Rib under the arms and finished with a deep ribbed hem. The sleeves also have Half Fisherman’s Rib under the arm. Stitches are picked up for the collar and worked in Half Fisherman’s Rib.

pattern_author.name: Rebecca Clow
pattern_author.notes:
I'm Rebecca, a knitwear designer and youtuber based in Edinburgh, Scotland. 

I released my first pattern, the Cargill sweater, in October 2022 and I've been designing ever since. I love to design easy-wearing, classic knits that are just as enjoyable to work up as they are to wear. 

When I'm not knitting I'm out on a dog walk; trying to grow some veggies in our little garden; sailing somewhere on our little boat; or trying to find the best vegan food and coffee that our city has to offer!

name: Sweater No. 30
gauge_description: 18 stitches and 27 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Sweater No. 30 is an oversized sweater with a high collar, distinctive saddle shoulders, and unique details.
The back and yoke are shaped with short rows to ensure a good fit.
The sleeves are designed to be wide at the top and taper at the cuffs.
The collar can be worked short or long, allowing it to be worn as is or folded into a turtleneck.
The sweater is worked from the top down, so you can try it on as you go and adjust it to your measurements.

SIZES
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)

MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 108 (112) 121 (128) 134 (141) 148 (154) cm 42.5 (44) 47.75 (50.5) 52.75 (55.5) 58.25 (60.75) inches
Length (measured at the center back): 54 (55) 57 (58) 60 (61) 62 (63) cm 21.25 (21.75) 22.5 (23) 23.5 (24) 24.5 (24.75) inches

Size guide
Sweater No. 30 has an oversized fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 20-25 cm 8-10 inches for sizes XS-XL and approx. 15-20 cm 6-8 inches for sizes 2XL-4XL. The positive ease is designed to provide the most flattering fit for each size.
Sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) are equivalent to European standard sizes and suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm 31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches.

For example: You measure 88 cm 34.75 inches at your widest + 20-25 cm 7.75-9.75 inches = 108-113 cm 42.5-44.5 inches. Therefore, you should knit a size S, which has a finished circumference of 112 cm 44 inches.

Sweater No. 30 is ideal for an extra-oversized fit. The model is usually wearing size S and in the picture she wears size L.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
5 mm US 8 circular needles (80 or 100 cm) 32 or 40 inches
4 mm US 6 circular needles (80 or 100 cm and 40 cm) 32 or 40 and 16 inches

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 5 mm US 8.

18 sts / 27 rows =10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches.

The given gauge is measured after washing and blocking.

MATERIALS

450-500 (500) 550 (600-650) 650 (700) 700 (750) Yak, Lang Yarns, 50 gr / 120 m.

Work the sweater using a single strand of yarn.

users.about_me:
Behind My Favourite Things you'll meet Louise. 
Louise has been working in the Danish fashion industry for more than a decade, and has been taking part in developing and growing well-known designer brands for years.  

From the very beginning of MFTK, Louise's main focus has been to create classic and timeless wardrobe favourites of high quality, that lasts for more than a season: simple but aesthetically pleasing designs with thought out details, always aiming for 'the perfect fit'. 

Louise says; 'After more than a decade in the fashion industry, I experienced a saturation of overconsumption and mass production. I felt a need to go back to my roots, crafting my wardrobe with my own hands.
I was frustrated to see how collections became outdated almost before they hit the stores, and wanted to create something more long-lasting. 
This is how the idea of MFTK came to life.
I've taken the advantage of my many years of experience within fashion and design and created a brand of timeless knitwear without an expiry date.'

At MFTK you'll find knitting patterns at all different stages of difficulty. The patterns are written in a precise and straight forward language, making MFTK a great choice for both brand new and more experienced knitters. The wide range of patterns allows you to develop your personal knitting skills elevate to the next level.

You can follow the universe of the brand at Instagram @myfavouritethings.knitwear.

If you have questions, comments or concerns, you are welcome to write us a message at support@mftknitwear.com. 
We are a very small team, so please have patience with us. 

Welcome!

name: The Loon Sweater
sizes_available: XXS, XS, S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL, XXXXL
gauge_description: 20 stitches and 26 rows = 4 inches
notes_html:
The Loon Sweater was originally created as a Christmas present for my dad, and was inspired by the many summers we’ve spent listening to the loons call each other across the lake.

Construction: This sweater is a simple drop shoulder design, and is knit from the top down. It is designed to have 20-30cm / 8-12” of positive ease. You’ll begin by working the back yoke flat, shaping the shoulders with German short rows, and working in stockinette before introducing the loon mural using stranded colourwork (also worked flat). The front yoke is then worked flat, starting with picking up and knitting each shoulder
separately while shaping the neckline. The front shoulders are then joined to complete the neck opening, and the loon mural continues across the front in stranded colourwork (worked flat). Once the front and back yokes are complete, they are joined to form the body, which is knit in the round. Stitches are then picked up for the sleeves and neckline, both of which are worked in
the round.

Sizes: XXS, XS, S, M, L, XL, XXL, XXXL, XXXXL
(In the pattern photos: The white loon sweater is a size M, the black and blue loon sweaters are size L)

Sweater Chest Circumference: 84, 94, 102, 112, 122, 132, 142, 154, 164 cm / 33, 37, 40, 44, 48, 52, 56, 60, 64 in

Gauge: 20st x 26 rows = 10cm x 10cm (4” x 4”) washed and blocked

Suggested Needles: Circular needles: 4.5 mm US7 / 40, 60 and 80 or 100 cm /16, 24 and 32 or 40”, 4.5mm double pointed needles

Suggest Yarn:
Estelle Highland Alpaca Worsted (100g = 185 meters) / (3.53 oz = 202 yds)
Main colour: 600, 600, 600, 600, 700, 700, 700, 800, 800g
Contrast colour: 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100, 100g

OR

Knitting for Olive Heavy Merino (50g = 125m) / (1.76 oz = 137 yds)
Main colour: 550, 550, 600, 600, 650, 650, 700, 750, 750g
Contrast colour: 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 50, 100, 100g

Additional Materials: Tapestry needle, scissors, stitch markers, measuring tape

*If you do not see your size reflected in the size range, please reach out to me at cmknits6@gmail.com*

Pattern Download:
Once payment is received, you will receive an email containing a download link button for the PDF pattern

Questions: If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me by email at cmknits6@gmail.com

Social Media:
Instagram: @cm_knits_
TikTok: cm_knits

This pattern is a copyright of CM Knits. The Loon Sweaters created using this pattern may not be sold without written consent first given by CM Knits. Credit must be given to CM Knits. Pattern and photos can not be used for resale purposes.

name: Sweater No. 25
gauge_description: 15 stitches and 22 rows = 4 inches in Stockinette
notes_html:
Sweater No. 25 is a classic, oversize roll-neck sweater.
The shoulders are shaped and constructed in such a way that the shoulder seams sit towards the back, which ensures a great fit.
Carefully placed increases and decreases at the neckline and on the sleeves catch the eye and add an extra detail. The sleeves are wider at the top and narrows towards the wrist.

SIZES
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)

MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 119 (125) 136 (147) 153 (159) 169 (176) cm 46.75 (49) 53.5 (57.75) 60 (62.5) 66.5 (69.25) inches
Length (measured at the center back, below the neckline): 60 (61) 63 (65) 66 (68) 69 (70) cm 23.5 (24) 25 (25.5) 26 (27) 27 (27.5) inches

Size guide
Sweater No. 25 has an oversize fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 35-40 cm 13.75-15.75 inches.
Sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) are equivalent to European standard sizing and suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm 31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches.

In example: You measure at 88 cm 34.5 inches at your widest + 35-40 cm 13.75-15.75 inches = 123-128 cm 48.25-50.25 inches. Meaning you would choose a size S with a finished circumference of 125 cm 49 inches.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
6 mm US 10 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
5 mm US 8 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)

GAUGE
In stocking stitch using 6 mm US 10 needles.

15 sts / 22 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches.

MATERIALS
200 (200) 250 (250) 250 (300) 300 (300) gr Alpaca 2, Isager Yarn, 250 m / 50 gr.

held together with…

250 (250) 300 (300) 300 (350) 350 (350) gr Tweed, Isager Yarn, 200 m. / 50 gr.

held together with…

125 (125) 150 (150) 150 (175) 175 (175) gr Silk Mohair, Isager Yarn, 212 m. / 25 gr.

Work the sweater holding 3 strands of yarn together. One strand of Alpaca 2, one strand of Tweed and one strand of Silk Mohair.
notes:
Sweater No. 25 is a classic, oversize roll-neck sweater. 
The shoulders are shaped and constructed in such a way that the shoulder seams sit towards the back, which ensures a great fit.
Carefully placed increases and decreases at the neckline and on the sleeves catch the eye and add an extra detail. The sleeves are wider at the top and narrows towards the wrist. 


SIZES 
XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL)


MEASUREMENTS
Circumference: 119 (125) 136 (147) 153 (159) 169 (176) cm [46.75 (49) 53.5 (57.75) 60 (62.5) 66.5 (69.25) inches]
Length (measured at the center back, below the neckline): 60 (61) 63 (65) 66 (68) 69 (70) cm [23.5 (24) 25 (25.5) 26 (27) 27 (27.5) inches]

Size guide 
Sweater No. 25 has an oversize fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 35-40 cm [13.75-15.75 inches]. 
Sizes XS (S) M (L) XL (2XL) 3XL (4XL) are equivalent to European standard sizing and suit a bust circumference of approx. 80-85 (85-90) 90-95 (95-100) 100-110 (110-120) 120-130 (130-140) cm [31.5-33.5 (33.5-35.5) 35.5-37.5 (37.5-39.5) 39.5-43.25 (43.25-47.25) 47.25-51.25 (51.25-55) inches].

In example: You measure at 88 cm [34.5 inches] at your widest + 35-40 cm [13.75-15.75 inches] = 123-128 cm [48.25-50.25 inches]. Meaning you would choose a size S with a finished circumference of 125 cm [49 inches]. 



SUGGESTED NEEDLES  
6 mm [US 10] circular needles (80 or 100 cm [32 or 40 inches])
5 mm [US 8] circular needles (80 or 100 cm [32 or 40 inches])


GAUGE 
In stocking stitch using 6 mm [US 10] needles.

15 sts / 22 rows = 10 x 10 cm [4 x 4 inches].


MATERIALS
200 (200) 250 (250) 250 (300) 300 (300) gr Alpaca 2, Isager Yarn, 250 m / 50 gr. 

held together with… 

250 (250) 300 (300) 300 (350) 350 (350) gr Tweed, Isager Yarn, 200 m. / 50 gr. 

held together with… 

125 (125) 150 (150) 150 (175) 175 (175) gr Silk Mohair, Isager Yarn, 212 m. / 25 gr. 

Work the sweater holding 3 strands of yarn together. One strand of Alpaca 2, one strand of Tweed and one strand of Silk Mohair.

users.about_me:
Behind My Favourite Things you'll meet Louise. 
Louise has been working in the Danish fashion industry for more than a decade, and has been taking part in developing and growing well-known designer brands for years.  

From the very beginning of MFTK, Louise's main focus has been to create classic and timeless wardrobe favourites of high quality, that lasts for more than a season: simple but aesthetically pleasing designs with thought out details, always aiming for 'the perfect fit'. 

Louise says; 'After more than a decade in the fashion industry, I experienced a saturation of overconsumption and mass production. I felt a need to go back to my roots, crafting my wardrobe with my own hands.
I was frustrated to see how collections became outdated almost before they hit the stores, and wanted to create something more long-lasting. 
This is how the idea of MFTK came to life.
I've taken the advantage of my many years of experience within fashion and design and created a brand of timeless knitwear without an expiry date.'

At MFTK you'll find knitting patterns at all different stages of difficulty. The patterns are written in a precise and straight forward language, making MFTK a great choice for both brand new and more experienced knitters. The wide range of patterns allows you to develop your personal knitting skills elevate to the next level.

You can follow the universe of the brand at Instagram @myfavouritethings.knitwear.

If you have questions, comments or concerns, you are welcome to write us a message at support@mftknitwear.com. 
We are a very small team, so please have patience with us. 

Welcome!

name: Sweater No. 20
gauge_description: 21 stitches and 26 rows = 4 inches in Cables
notes_html:
Sweater No. 20 is an oversized, cabled sweater.
It has a boxy fit and dropped shoulders. The wide neck rib is a focal point of the sweater and makes for a unique feature.
The sweater is worked from the top down and requires minimal finishing.

SIZES
1 (2) 3

MEASUREMENTS
Length (measured at the center back): 58 (61) 64 cm 23 (24) 25 inches
Circumference: 116 (125) 136 cm 45.5 (49) 53.5 inches

SIZE GUIDE
Sweater No. 20 has an oversize fit. Calculate a positive ease of approx. 30 (30) 20 cm 12 (12) 8 inches in relation to your bust circumference.
Sizes 1 (2) 3 are equivalent to the European standard sizes: XS-S (M-L) XL-XXL and suit a body circumference of approx. 80-90 (90-100) 100-120 cm 31.5-35.5 (35.5-39.25) 39.25-47.25 inches.
If you are in between sizes, size up.

For example: You measure 90 cm 35.5 inches at your widest + 30 cm 12 inches = 120 cm 47.5 inches. Meaning you would choose a size 2 with a finished circumference of 125 cm 49 inches.

SUGGESTED NEEDLES
5.5 mm US 9 circular needles (80 or 100 cm 32 or 40 inches)
4.5 mm US 7 circular needles (40 cm or 80 cm 16 or 32 inches)

GAUGE
In cabled pattern using 5.5 mm US 9 circular needles:
21 sts / 26 rows = 10 x 10 cm 4 x 4 inches

MATERIALS
Work the sweater holding two strands of yarn together. One of each quality.

600 (650) 750 gr. Peruvian Highland Wool, Filcolana, 50 gr. / 100 m.
Shown in colour 977, ‘Marcipan’.

held together with…

175 (200) 200 gr. Alva, Filcolana, 25 gr. / 175 m. Shown in colour 977, ‘Marcipan’.

Yarn alternative
Work the sweater holding two strands of yarn together. One of each quality.

550 (600) 650 gr Heavy Merino, Knitting for Olive 50 gr. / 125 m.

held together with…

150 (150) 175 gr. Soft Silk Mohair, Knitting for Olive, 25 gr. / 225 m.
